author: Brock_the_Builder
title: Pure Awesomeness!
review: This clock is awesome!  The large minifig idea is fantastic.  It is fully pose-able with moving arms, legs, hands, and head.  When you press on the head, it activates the clock's backlight.  Vader's backlight is red.  Pressing on the head also activates the snooze function.  The clock and alarm controls are very easy to use.  I recommend this clock to anyone who loves Lego minifigs, Star Wars, or both!  It is a MUST HAVE for all Lego fans.

author: Slobrojoe
title: Hughh huhhh, hughh huhhh (breathing noises are repeated several times)
review:
I got this as a Christmas present a long time ago. 
The minifigure is of Darth Vader (duh) and has the usual printing on the front apart from the clock. The helmet can not be taken off but the arms and legs are movable. The controls on the back can be tiresome if you drastically need to change the minute and does tend to slow down. The batteries are quite reliable but have to be replaced every other year at most. It comes with a snooze and alarm function. If you press down the head, the clock lights up. At a certain angle, it is quite hard to see and might reflect light or could be hard to differentiate between 6 and 8. The light is red. 

Overall, the clock is pretty good but there are some better designs.
